items.name: Twist, turn. Shake
As cold water hisses against bare skin,
Trickling down my naked back.
Wet hair forked like a snake's tongue, I've found
A single white strand in a sea of black
Always there, no matter how many times
I pull and I pull and I pull.
Your ink decides to form mountains
Dark rivulets of water seeping down
Into each day, you said
'This is the only way
To keep my hands from shaking,' and you
Set your brush down on the page
Again and again and again.
These days, these days
My fingers rise and fall, rise and fall
to remind me of where my body is
And how to escape it.
How to pace the confines of a space
Hardly mine, twenty steps to cross
The living room, thirty to get to the
Bedroom, five to arrive at the kitchen. Your body
Moves, my body mirrors, circling the carpeted floor
In our slow and ambling way. Repeat.
If only you'd lift your gaze to meet mine
One seems to be swimming in time, the other
Drowning in it â€” I close my eyes
And wonder what it will be like,
The waves lapping over our bodies,
A slow drift into nothing.
How easy it is to slip away
Black brushed into silver strands
At night, sinking into the screen
At dawn, once again
Coming into being, a means
To an end I am still drifting towards,
An end back to the beginning.
The same body huddled under the showerhead,
The same bodies in which we live once more.
